title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 July 2014 - XWiki
content:

09:15 <Enygma`> has quit  
09:16 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <woshilapin> has quit  
09:26 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <gdelhumeau> I'm working on the failing tests on xwiki-enterprie-ui  
10:50 <vmassol> ok let's try to release 6.1 today  
10:50 <vmassol> since every day that passes is one day less for 6.2  
11:14 <gdelhumeau> I have a problem with appwithinminutes tests  
11:14 <gdelhumeau> it seems that "new Actions(getDriver()).dragAndDrop(field, fields).perform();" does not work  
11:19 <andreeapopescu> vincent: Hi  
11:20 <andreeapopescu> vmassol: Hi! Can you please create a project on Jira for http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/MindMap+Application?  
11:20 <andreeapopescu> because I have to report some bugs  
11:20 <vmassol> andreeapopescu: let me check  
11:20 <vmassol> we have several options  
11:21 <andreeapopescu> ok, thanks  
11:22 <vmassol> well for this case, this macro is NOT managed by us  
11:22 <vmassol> it's not in xwiki-contrib  
11:22 <vmassol> which means it's handled by the contributor fully  
11:23 <vmassol> so the only place to report an issue is in comments on that extension I believe  
11:24 <andreeapopescu> Ok. thank you  
11:24 <vmassol> you can link that comment in your table  
11:24 <andreeapopescu> yes  
11:25 <andreeapopescu> thanks  
11:25 <vmassol> the other option would be ask the contributor about moving his code to xwiki-contrib and creating a jira project for it but it takes more time to do so  
11:25 <vmassol> we need to decide if we want to push for this or not  
11:26 <vmassol> it's a good question  
11:31 <lucaa> has quit  
11:32 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:34 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <lucaa> has quit  
12:01 <gdelhumeau> We have java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to initialize PersistentTestContext on a lot of tests  
12:10 <andreeapopescu> vmassol: But, for this… can you make a Jira project? (simple Recruitment App has a Jira Project) http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Recruitment+Management+Application  
12:10 <vmassol> checking  
12:16 <vmassol> andreeapopescu: is it on github?  
12:16 <andreeapopescu> checking  
12:16 <vmassol> (I don't think so)  
12:17 <vmassol> there's https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-recruitment  
12:17 <vmassol> but I'm not sure if it's the same one  
12:17 <andreeapopescu> yes https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-recruitmentmanager  
12:17 <andreeapopescu> yes, it is.. because the other recruitment project is for simple Recruitment App developed by Alex Chelariu  
12:18 <vmassol> this one is http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Recruitment+application  
12:18 <andreeapopescu> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-recruitmentmanager  
12:18 <andreeapopescu> and this is for Recruitment Manager  
12:22 <vmassol> so  
12:23 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Recruitment+Management+Application is old  
12:23 <vmassol> and has been replaced by http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Recruitment+application  
12:23 <vmassol> thus no need to create anything for it  
12:23 <andreeapopescu> aha.. ok, thank you  
12:23 <vmassol> I've updated all links to mention that  
12:24 <vmassol> you can still put a comment on the page if you wish  
12:24 <andreeapopescu> ok, thank you  
12:28 <vmassol> andreeapopescu: might be to explain what is not working  
12:28 <vmassol> "+The app is not working for me on XE 6.0.1." is not that useful :)  
12:29 <vmassol> you could even put a screenshot if you want  
12:29 <andreeapopescu> the app is doing nothing  
12:30 <andreeapopescu> I read the behavior, but… nothing happened  
12:30 <vmassol> have you installed the prerequisites?  
12:30 <andreeapopescu> yes  
12:31 <andreeapopescu> I will try to install on other version  
12:31 <vmassol> "This application requires the http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Semantic+Tagging+Extension."  
12:31 <vmassol> ?  
12:31 <vmassol> no need on other version  
12:32 <andreeapopescu> it’s not working for me  
12:32 <vmassol> not working doesn't me anything  
12:32 <vmassol> s/me/mean  
12:33 <andreeapopescu> I don’t know what to say more…  
12:33 <vmassol> again, have you installed http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Semantic+Tagging+Extension ?  
12:33 <andreeapopescu> yes  
12:33 <vmassol> have you tested the provided script?  
12:34 <andreeapopescu> no  
12:34 <vmassol> did you copy the vm in the right places?  
12:34 <andreeapopescu> yes  
12:35 <andreeapopescu> I told you.. I tested this a few times, same result  
12:35 <andreeapopescu> maybe is from my laptop/ my settings/ don’t know  
12:35 <vmassol> no it's not  
12:35 <vmassol> it's jsut that this app is hard to install IMO  
12:35 <vmassol> have you done this: "Add the zemanta-api jars to to the webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib folder in the XWiki platform." ?  
12:35 <andreeapopescu> yes  
12:36 <vmassol> which version?  
12:36 <vmassol> it's possible you've used a recent version  
12:36 <andreeapopescu> don’t know exactly  
12:36 <andreeapopescu> I tested the app few weeks ago  
12:36 <vmassol> so you created an account on http://developer.zemanta.com/  
12:36 <vmassol> ?  
12:36 <vmassol> and got a key?  
12:36 <vmassol> how did you get the zemanta-api jars ?  
12:37 <andreeapopescu> ok.. I will reinstall the app  
12:37 <andreeapopescu> because.. it was 3 weeks ago  
12:37 <vmassol> how did you get that jar 3 weeks ago?  
12:37 <andreeapopescu> yes, I guess.. I can’t remember exactly  
12:38 <vmassol> also  
12:38 <vmassol> you shouldl try to improve the doc to install apps when you see issues  
12:38 <vmassol> here I see several issues  
12:38 <vmassol> I really doubt that you got the zemanta jar  
12:39 <vmassol> and that you built it with ant  
12:39 <vmassol> that's a lot of work ;)  
12:39 <andreeapopescu> then.. I will try to test the app with a dev  
12:39 <andreeapopescu> maybe.. was smth I forgot..  
12:59 <exekewtable> has joined #xwiki  
13:32 <D-Spair> has quit  
13:35 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:37 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
13:39 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <msmeria1> has quit  
13:56 <exekewtable> has quit  
13:58 <mflorea> vmassol: quick syntax question. Is there a way to escape the new line in xwiki 2.1 syntax? i.e. split a long line in multiple lines in the source but keep a single line in the output (no BRs)  
13:59 <vmassol> I don't think so  
13:59 <mflorea> ok, thanks  
13:59 <vmassol> we just have a way to force a new line  
13:59 <vmassol> using \\  
13:59 <mflorea> yes  
14:00 <vmassol> but not the opposite...  
14:02 <vmassol> you can fake it with a noop macro but not sure it's very useful...  
14:02 <vmassol> (a macro with just a new line in its content)  
14:03 <vmassol> (an inline macro that does nothing and with just a new line in its content to be precise)  
14:03 <vmassol> actually  
14:04 <vmassol> the {{comment}} macro would work  
14:04 <vmassol> mflorea:  see http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA  
14:05 <mflorea> I see, a little too verbose :)  
14:05 <vmassol> yep  
14:45 <msmeria> has quit
